title: GottaGo
text:
GottaGo





Wann musst du von zu Hause los um deinen Bus zu erwischen? GottaGo sagst dir! Grün heisst jetzt ist der richtige Zeitpunkt dafür Go Bei Rot reichts nicht mehr und wenns aus ist, kann man gehen oder auch nicht. 


GottaGo.ch


Unter http://www.gottago.ch erstellst du deinen GottaGo, du musst dafür deine Haltestelle, die gewünschte Linie und die Zeitdauer von zu Hause zur Haltestelle eintragen. Die GottaGo Webseite generiert dir einen GottaGo-Key mit welchen du entweder auf der Webseite selber oder auf verschiedenen Clients benutzen kannst den Status abfragen kannst.


Die Daten dazu stammen aus dem Transport.API Projekt. 


Die Webseite ist mit Drupal 7 gebaut, dafür wurden einige Module geschrieben, zu finden hier: https://github.com/Schnitzel/GottaGo


GottaGo Anzeigen


Durch die GottaGo Anzeigen erfährst du am effizientesten wann du loslaufen musst. Die Idee von GottaGo ist, dass es ganz verschiedene Anzeigen gibt, je nachdem was du am liebsten hättest.


Webseite


Die Webseite bietet selbst eine Anzeige direkt im Browser, hier ein Beispiel: http://gottago.ch/gottago_client/Cahi


Chrome Browser Extension


Eine Chrome Browser Extension, welche dir den Status deines GottaGo direkt im Browser anzeigt gibt es auf GitHub.


Arduino Lampe


Ganz nach dem Vorbild der Busstop Lampe von Christian haben wir ein kleines Arduino Script gebaut, welches autonom via dem Ethernet Shield den Status eines GottaGo abfragen kann. Den SourceCode gibts hier: https://github.com/Schnitzel/GottaGo-Arduino


Eigene Anzeigen


GottaGo kommuniziert über JSON mit seinen Anzeigen. Für eigene Anzeigen wie Töne, Anwendungen oder Browserplugins kann dieses Format einfach ausgelesen werden. Eine Beispieldatei mit umfangreichen Kommentaren steht unter https://github.com/Schnitzel/GottaGo/blob/master/documentation/sample.json zur Verfügung.


Ein einfacher Client für in JavaScript steht ebenfalls in Form einer Website zur Verfügung. Der Quellcode ist unter https://github.com/Schnitzel/GottaGo/tree/master/documentation/client zu finden.


 live,
	 transport

title: Data2Open
text:
data2open


__ZIEL?__


 OpenData Community helfen, Daten zu erhalten und ihre Ideen zu stärken

 OpenData Market zu schaffen, auf dem Daten ausgetauscht werden können



__WER?__


Ideatoren:


 Victor Schlegel (victor.schlegel AT gmail.com)

 Peter Buchmann (peter AT buchmann.info)



Daten Konsumenten:


 Community

 Öffentliche Einrichtungen

 (Umwelt) Verbände

  Firmen

  BürgerInnen



Daten Lieferanten:


 Individuen



__WARUM?__


 Daten als Währung anstelle von Geld oder Werbung

 Einsicht, dass Daten für die Community einen Nutzen bringen (Beispiel http://www.waze.com/, https://sites.google.com/site/sleepasandroid/, http://www.communicar.de/magazin/tests/co2_apps_im_test.html)

  Idealismus

  Profiteur von Daten kann Helfer überzeugen

  Bewusstsein für eigene, digitale Spuren wecken



__WIE?__


 Anonymisiert

  Wird Mitgliedern der Community zur Verfügung gestellt

  Daten dürfen nicht verkauft werden

 Im Moment ist es möglich, aus einem Android Gerät folgende Daten auszulesen:



Positioning


 Location

 Bluetooth

 Wifi

 Cell



Social


 Contact

 Call Log

 SMS



Motion


 Accelerometer Sensor

 Gravity Sensor

 Linear Acceleration Sensor

 Gyroscope Sensor

 Orientation Sensor

 Rotation Vector Sensor

 Activity



Environment


 Light Sensor

 Proximity Sensor

 Magnetic Field Sensor

 Pressure Sensor

 Temperature Sensor



Device


 Android Info

 Battery

 Hardware Info

 Time Offset

 Telephony



Device Interaction


 Running Applications

 Applications

 Screen

 Browser Bookmarks

 Browser Searches

 Videos

 Audio Files

 Images



Für weitere Details siehe: http://code.google.com/p/funf-open-sensing-framework/wiki/BuiltinProbes


__RESSOURCEN?__


Apps


  FUNF JOURNAL von MIT: http://funf.media.mit.edu/journal.html

 Sensor data reading with Scratch prog. language: http://smartphonedaq.com/scratch-sensor.page



Market Places Konzept & Implementation


 tbd



DB Konzept & Implementation


 tbd



Security Konzept & Implementation


 tbd



__Use Cases__


 Ein Quertier möchte eine Karte aller Handy Antennen erstellen (Location,Cell, Anzahl sichtbarer Antennen, Intensität). 

 Verband XY möchte erheben, wie warm die Wohnungen einer Stadt im Winter geheizt sind, um das Sparpotential an Öl und CO2 zu schätzen (Temperatur, Accelerator, Location in PLZ umgerechnet).



__WIE WEITER?__


 Data Market aufbauen, auf dem Datennachfrage mit dem Datenangebot treffen

 Datenaustausch über Config (Metadata) beschreiben

 Bewertung der Datenqualität

 Regulierung des Datenzugriffs; Sicherheit für Daten gewährleisten (nur Kommunity-Mitglieder haben Zugriff)

 Verbesserung der Software (z.B. Detailliertere Metadaten-Kategorisierung würde helfen)

 Suche nach Android-Entwicklern, Psychologen, Statistik-Experten, die hier mitmachen



__DATA REQUESTS & PROVISIONING?__


 Bitte Datenanfragen auf dieser WIKI platzieren. 

 Falls Du die Daten über die App zur Verfügung stellen kannst, bitte dies ebenfalls auf dieser WIKI erfassen

 Wir arbeiten gerade am Data Market, auf dem solche Datenanfragen & Datenabgebot leichter zu platzieren, bewerten, etc. sind.



__FEEDBACK?__


 Wir wären um Euren Feedback sehr verbunden und dankbar, wenn Ihr diesen hier erfasst.



 concept

title: PMR-openfixmap
text:
PMR-openfixmap


The team


 Simon PERDRISAT - perdrisat_AT_gmail.com

 Luca CAPELLO – luca_AT_pca.it 

 Jean-Pierre KAZEMI – contact_AT_public-image.ch

 Eduardo CAMACHO-HÜBNER – eduardo.camacho-huebner_AT_transitec.net

 Philippe VINCENT – philippe.vincent.labs_AT_gmail.com

 Alexandre POLTORAK - a.poltorak_AT_free-it-foundation.org

 Marc-André EGGIMANN - eggimann_AT_inneo-consulting.com 



Project description


The mobility application for Reduced Mobility People : interactive map - extended itinerary - services


 Acces cartography to restaurants, WC, parking lots, fuel stations, obstacles, … This allready exist see http://wheelmap.org/ and their is discussion to integrate that directly in OSM http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Disabilities

 An automatique system to collect system along “user paths” (pitfalls, tricks, seamless tracks…), can of already made http://www.rollstuhlrouting.de/

 What OSM is not going to do is represent “missing” things. So in a similar whay than http://www.fixmystreet.com/ with can create a layer for openstreetmap where we can report general problem, and of course accessible problem.



How to use it


1- Start the app: http://openfixmap.pca.it


2- Choose one of the four following actions


 enlarge and look at the map where you are located

 enlarge and look at the sceen you face at the location (via your camera or streetview)

 select your mobility constraint profile (needed only if first use or profile change)

 create a new tag



You can also sign in and out using specific buttons


2.1- The map page
You see your location on a map. 
The map shows you the access informations available
You can directly create informations (tag) by pressing one of the three smileys on the botto of the current screen


2.2- The sceen page
You see the sceen you face right now (using our camera or streetview)
The sceen show you the existence of acces informations
You can directly create, modify, contribute to informations (tag) by pressing one of the three smileys on the botto of the current screen


2.3- The profile selection page
You can select your mobility constraint profile among a set of possible choices.
The profile selection is needed only for a first use or a profile change


2.4- The tag creation page
You access a specific and enlarged tag creation page


Road Map


Move to a better techno


 Documents technical possibilities.

 Ask wheelmap.org for their code source



Link and idea


http://polymaps.org
http://www.openlayers.org


IRC


 http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=pmropenfixmap

 http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=makeopendata



How we worked


http://posterous.com/posts/edit/117278774 (not accessible, please publish that on the wiki)


Project license


 GNU Affero General Public License v3

 Drupal related code and configuration is under GNU General Public License, version 2



Useful links


PMR


 http://wheelmap.org/

 http://rollstuhlkarte.ch/ (similar project from Zürich session)

 http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/List_of_OSM_based_Services#Accessibility_for_persons_with_disabilities

 http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Disabilities



travelling


 http://greenmonkeys.com/

 http://www.openrouteservice.org/

 http://make.opendata.ch/doku.php?id=project:geneve-velo



OpenStreetMap


 http://make.opendata.ch/doku.php?id=project:sieste

 http://make.opendata.ch/doku.php?id=project:sitg2osm

The mobility application for Reduced Mobility People : interactive map - extended itinerary - services

  • Acces cartography to restaurants, WC, parking lots, fuel stations, obstacles, This allready exist see http://wheelmap.org/ and their is discussion to integrate that directly in OSM http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Disabilities
  • An automatique system to collect system along user paths (pitfalls, tricks, seamless tracks), can of already made http://www.rollstuhlrouting.de/
  • What OSM is not going to do is represent missing things. So in a similar whay than http://www.fixmystreet.com/ with can create a layer for openstreetmap where we can report general problem, and of course accessible problem.

How to use it

1- Start the app: http://openfixmap.pca.it

2- Choose one of the four following actions

  1. enlarge and look at the map where you are located
  2. enlarge and look at the sceen you face at the location (via your camera or streetview)
  3. select your mobility constraint profile (needed only if first use or profile change)
  4. create a new tag

You can also sign in and out using specific buttons

2.1- The map page You see your location on a map. The map shows you the access informations available You can directly create informations (tag) by pressing one of the three smileys on the botto of the current screen

2.2- The sceen page You see the sceen you face right now (using our camera or streetview) The sceen show you the existence of acces informations You can directly create, modify, contribute to informations (tag) by pressing one of the three smileys on the botto of the current screen

2.3- The profile selection page You can select your mobility constraint profile among a set of possible choices. The profile selection is needed only for a first use or a profile change

2.4- The tag creation page You access a specific and enlarged tag creation page

Road Map

Move to a better techno

  • Documents technical possibilities.
  • Ask wheelmap.org for their code source

Link and idea

http://polymaps.org http://www.openlayers.org

IRC

  • http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=pmropenfixmap
  • http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=makeopendata

How we worked

http://posterous.com/posts/edit/117278774 (not accessible, please publish that on the wiki)

Project license

  • GNU Affero General Public License v3
  • Drupal related code and configuration is under GNU General Public License, version 2

title: Where's My Tower
text:
Tower Track





A mobile web app (for Firefox OS Marketplace and mobile web browsers) that shows the promixity of the user to the nearest radio communication tower in Switzerland. This allows a user without reception to know in which direction to walk to get a signal, or for people trying to go as offline as possible to find the nearest “hole” in reception. 


Note: as signal quality varies strongly depending on the height difference and topography of the land, distance alone is not enough to paint an accurate picture of signal reception. This app may not be relied upon in an emergency.



Data


Cell phone tower locations in Switzerland are provided by BAKOM (department of communications) on their old Web Geo site - see metadata records. They have now been migrated into layers of the GeoAdmin API, accessible through the main map or here: BAKOM - Standorte von Sendeanlagen.


For the hackday where this project started, a subset of the data for the Canton of Geneva was made available to us via the Geneva geoportal. Special thanks to Adrien Viera from SITG for his help with this.



An early screenshot of the hackday app


The current version loads data about GSM tower locations (UMTS and LTE can be added in a production release), positions the map with the HTML5 geolocation API, and creates a heatmap of antennas with geoservices of the GeoAdmin API and heatmap.js.


Built around a framework that is particularly suited to new Firefox OS phones, the app also has an experimental orientation sensor feature to rotate the map in sync with the compass on select handsets.


Team


 loleg



Links


 Live app: http://towertrack.utou.ch/

 https://marketplace.firefox.com/app/tower-track-ch

 Source: https://github.com/loleg/tower-track-ch

title: Public Transport jSignage
text:
Swiss Public Transport Data rendered in SVG using the jSignage API





This project is an attempt to use SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) for rendering Swiss Public Transport related information. It is interesting to choose SVG rather than HTML because there are media players that can display SVG. Such media players are well suited for screens in public areas and it makes a good use case of open standards in the world of digital signage. 


Sample preview: http://www.free-ds.ch/projects/jsignage-transport/index.svg


Source


 github.com/cloup/jsignage-transport



Data


 Swiss Public Transport API



Team


 Christophe Loup (freestudios)



Links


 JSignage API

 SVG enabled players from Spinetix

title: Transport API
text:
Transport API





 Documentation: transport.opendata.ch

 Source: github.com/OpendataCH/transport



Sub Projects


Vision


 Explore Realtime aspects of Open Data, with the Transport API as an example.
 Realtime means: an event in the system that is of immediate commercial or human interest (i.e has possible consequences).


RealTime PubSub Engine for Opendata based on HTML5 Websockets


 Initiator: @der_graf

 Repo: https://github.com/dergraf/Opendata-PubSub

 Live at: http://transport-ws.publ.io/static/index.html

 Opendata-PubSub is a Websocket handler written in Erlang

 It lets clients subscribe to certain event classes via Javascript (websockets), and pushes updates if these events occur

 It polls the Transport API for realtime events (transforming pulls into pushes)



Extend and improve the Realtime aspects of the Transport API


The Transport API is not optimal for realtime information. If there, it's encapsulated in Prognosis objects. Can we extend the API to be able to ask for things like “delay” directly?


 Initiator: @drdol

 Examples: delay, change of departing platform

 By that provide a simpler interface for realtime info (extracting it out of the Prognosis object etc)

 Write a service that lets you subscribe to those events (Opendata-PubSub)



The RealTime PubSub Engine and the Protocol Extension can be the infrastructure for automatic pushes of RealTime info to an unlimited number of clients.


Build a Command Line Interface for the Transport Data


See fahrplan.py


Examples


 http://rollstuhlkarte.ch/



Changelog


 Testing with Travis CI

 Documentation for Stationboard

 Added train/bus number

 Caching

 Fixed Timezone, JSON-Header

 Nearby station search (In progress)



 Finish nearby search (by coordinates)

 Allow searching with via stations

 Display coordinates in correct format

 Connection steps (Lenzburg - Zürich HB - Zürich, Bäckeranlage)

 Limit parameter for connection requests

 Change date/time to use ISO format

 Basic logging: http://transport.opendata.ch/stats.php

	 transport

title: swiss_army_contaminated_sites
text:
Swiss Army Contaminated Sites


Live site: http://lab.interactivethings.com/swiss-army-contaminated-sites/


Die Armee wird in den kommenden Jahren teuer für ihre Altlasten zahlen müssen. Mit Schwermetallen belastete Kugelfänge, wilde Abfalldeponien, Rückstände von Flammenwerfern und lecke Tanklager gefährden das Grundwasser. In einzelnen Gemeinden haben Geologen Dutzende mit Umweltgiften belastete Standorte ausgemacht. Am stärksten betroffen sind die Kantone Bern, Freiburg, Waadt, St. Gallen Zürich und Tessin.


Das Generalsekretariat des Verteidigungsdepartements (VBS) führt ein «Kataster der belasteten Standorte». Darin sind rund schweizweit 1500 problematische Anlagen, Flächen, Abfüllstellen oder Produktionsstätten verzeichnet.

title: makeopendata
text:
Make Open Data





This is a meta-project with a goal to:


 maintain and improve the online platform make.opendata.ch

 support teams using linked code/collaboration tools

 gather and publish available statistics



In other words, by 'eating our own food' we want to crowdsource the ideas of our community for building the best support foundation for open source, open data projects.


Check out Oleg's State of the Crowd presentation for an overview of the past 6 months.

title: openletten
text:
OpenLetten


This project is less about “data” than the others, and more about “open”. Letten is a place at the Limmat river right behind the ZHdK building (where MakeOpenData is hosted) in Zürich, where lots of people like to swim.





Photo by Yago Veith www.yago1.com used under (CC BY-NC-ND 2.0)


Daily temperature measurements taken at this exact location are readily available on the Web, but they are published in a hard to parse PDF document oriented towards  “scientific”  readers. This projects shows what is necessary to make use of the same data to answer the simple question “Should I go swimming today”. Different visualizations are shown as a proof of concept. Finally a mashup connects the temperature to an LED to get a basic, physical “ambient notification”.


The aim of OpenLetten is to show how hard it is to parse data if the publisher choses to only support the human readable data format (here PDF ), and how easy it becomes to build novel visualisations and mashups once the data is also published in an open, machine readable data format (e.g. CSV or RSS ).


Data


First, the PDF data is parsed by HwPdfToPachube.exe, a rather complex C# program given the simple task of extracting the current temperature. IT took me 4 hours to write it. The data is then published to Pachube, a sensor platform based on open data formats. There might of course be other such platforms that could be used.


 http://www.hw.zh.ch/hochwasser/mac/at/0851.PDF (Source data,     PDF )






 https://pachube.com/feeds/36745 (“Open” data, available as    XML, JSON, CSV feed)






Visualization


Once the data is available in an open format it's quite easy to consume and display it in  a way that suits the consumer rather than the publisher of the data (the visualizations below contain about 3 lines of code to get the data, compared to the 4 hours above). While the original PDF contains a lot more information, the current temperature is what's most interesting if you're about to decide if you should go for a swim. There is no way for the government to cater to such needs as they might be very special or of concern to a small minority only. Data in an open format empowers such groups to take action themselves and use the data they paid for with tax money in a way that serves them well.


 http://www.tamberg.org/makeopendata/2011/pachudial.html (PachuDial visualization, Flash, animated, live)

 http://www.tamberg.org/makeopendata/2011/jquery.html (Simple visualization, JSONP, live)

 http://www.tamberg.org/makeopendata/2011/googlecharts.html (Google Chart visualization including comfort zone, JSONP, live)






 http://try.yaler.net/~arduino/led (Arduino LED with a REST interface, LED color set by      HTTP PUT request from LettenLedMashup.exe, sorry for the ads, 504 if offline)






UPDATE, 29.03.2014


Here's a picture of an OpenLetten widget developed during the Samsung Smart TV Hackathon 2014.





Team


 tamberg 



Source


 https://bitbucket.org/tamberg/makeopendata/src/e504f66b1b56/2011/OpenLetten/HwPdfToPachube.cs 

 https://bitbucket.org/tamberg/makeopendata/src/e504f66b1b56/2011/OpenLetten/LettenLedMashup.cs 

 https://bitbucket.org/tamberg/samsungsmarttvhack (29.03.2014)



Links


 http://sourceforge.net/projects/itextsharp/files/ (      PDF to text C# library)

 http://www.paravan.ch/geocaching/#tools (CH-1903 to WGS-84 coordinate converter)

 http://code.google.com/apis/chart/ (Image and Javascript     API for visualisation)

 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSONP (Cross site scriptable JSON     API convention)

 https://pachube.com/ (Sensor data platform based on open standards)

 http://www.instructables.com/id/Arduino-Web-LED/ (How-to, including source code)

 http://yaler.org/ (Access to LED Web service running on Arduino; Disclosure: I'm a founder of Yaler)

 http://makeopendata.ch/forum/discussion/5/physical-mashup-of-a-multicolor-led-and-the-current-water-temperature-at-letten-environmental-data (initial discussion of the idea)

 http://www.thingiverse.com/thing:148319 (09.09.2013)

 https://data.stadt-zuerich.ch/dataset/wassertemperaturen-freibaeder (10.05.2016)

html:
OpenLetten

This project is less about data than the others, and more about open. Letten is a place at the Limmat river right behind the ZHdK building (where MakeOpenData is hosted) in Zrich, where lots of people like to swim.

Photo by Yago Veith www.yago1.com used under (CC BY-NC-ND 2.0)

Daily temperature measurements taken at this exact location are readily available on the Web, but they are published in a hard to parse PDF document oriented towards scientific readers. This projects shows what is necessary to make use of the same data to answer the simple question Should I go swimming today. Different visualizations are shown as a proof of concept. Finally a mashup connects the temperature to an LED to get a basic, physical ambient notification.

The aim of OpenLetten is to show how hard it is to parse data if the publisher choses to only support the human readable data format (here PDF ), and how easy it becomes to build novel visualisations and mashups once the data is also published in an open, machine readable data format (e.g. CSV or RSS ).

Data

First, the PDF data is parsed by HwPdfToPachube.exe, a rather complex C# program given the simple task of extracting the current temperature. IT took me 4 hours to write it. The data is then published to Pachube, a sensor platform based on open data formats. There might of course be other such platforms that could be used.

  • http://www.hw.zh.ch/hochwasser/mac/at/0851.PDF (Source data, PDF )

  • https://pachube.com/feeds/36745 (Open data, available as XML, JSON, CSV feed)

Visualization

Once the data is available in an open format it's quite easy to consume and display it in a way that suits the consumer rather than the publisher of the data (the visualizations below contain about 3 lines of code to get the data, compared to the 4 hours above). While the original PDF contains a lot more information, the current temperature is what's most interesting if you're about to decide if you should go for a swim. There is no way for the government to cater to such needs as they might be very special or of concern to a small minority only. Data in an open format empowers such groups to take action themselves and use the data they paid for with tax money in a way that serves them well.

  • http://www.tamberg.org/makeopendata/2011/pachudial.html (PachuDial visualization, Flash, animated, live)
  • http://www.tamberg.org/makeopendata/2011/jquery.html (Simple visualization, JSONP, live)
  • http://www.tamberg.org/makeopendata/2011/googlecharts.html (Google Chart visualization including comfort zone, JSONP, live)

  • http://try.yaler.net/~arduino/led (Arduino LED with a REST interface, LED color set by HTTP PUT request from LettenLedMashup.exe, sorry for the ads, 504 if offline)

UPDATE, 29.03.2014

Here's a picture of an OpenLetten widget developed during the Samsung Smart TV Hackathon 2014.

Team

  • tamberg

Source

  • https://bitbucket.org/tamberg/makeopendata/src/e504f66b1b56/2011/OpenLetten/HwPdfToPachube.cs
  • https://bitbucket.org/tamberg/makeopendata/src/e504f66b1b56/2011/OpenLetten/LettenLedMashup.cs
  • https://bitbucket.org/tamberg/samsungsmarttvhack (29.03.2014)

Links

  • http://sourceforge.net/projects/itextsharp/files/ ( PDF to text C# library)
  • http://www.paravan.ch/geocaching/#tools (CH-1903 to WGS-84 coordinate converter)
  • http://code.google.com/apis/chart/ (Image and Javascript API for visualisation)
  • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSONP (Cross site scriptable JSON API convention)
  • https://pachube.com/ (Sensor data platform based on open standards)
  • http://www.instructables.com/id/Arduino-Web-LED/ (How-to, including source code)
  • http://yaler.org/ (Access to LED Web service running on Arduino; Disclosure: I'm a founder of Yaler)
  • http://makeopendata.ch/forum/discussion/5/physical-mashup-of-a-multicolor-led-and-the-current-water-temperature-at-letten-environmental-data (initial discussion of the idea)
  • http://www.thingiverse.com/thing:148319 (09.09.2013)
  • https://data.stadt-zuerich.ch/dataset/wassertemperaturen-freibaeder (10.05.2016)
  • https://data.stadt-zuerich.ch/dataset/wassertemperaturen-freibaeder/resource/548d1ceb-1daf-4cf9-a14a-92c86326824d (10.05.2016)

title: mobility
text:
Mobility





Mobility is a very important aspect of our lives, no matter if you like hiking, biking, drive by car or take the train.


The team works on data mining, data creation and aggregation as well as finding ways to display the collected data in a useful manner.


Data


 GPS coordinates

 GPX to store POI

 KML



Current Projects


OpenWalks Platform


We are working on a social walkin/hiking/biking community platform. Therefore we want to make use of the Swisstopo maps found on http://map.geo.admin.ch. The aim is to create a web based portal, where you can add walks. This contains walk description, photos, and the ability to upload GPX files. From that, a map will be generated based on the Swisstopo map material with the GPX route description as overlay. This map will be displayed inline, within the portal


Others can edit the walks, comment on it or share it. It should also be possible to invite ppl to take a walk :)


We decided NOT to provide an app for tracking GPS data and generating GPX files, as there are good ones available already (e.g. Open GPS Tracker, see Links section).


We may provide an application that allows drawing of tracks on the map as addition to GPS data collection. (Vasile picked that task).


Benefits - compared to existing portals


 100% open and free

 Crowdsources - People upload and share GPX files.

 Rating, Comments

 “Meetup like community function



Current Status (20110930)


Oleg


 Clickdummy: http://opendata.utou.ch/wandern/ 



Remo


 Database Layout Description

 Core Programming

 Test Installation http://openwalks.org/test 



Marcus


 registered openwalks.org

 provided database and ftp access

 created Gitorious project https://gitorious.org/openwalks 



Kramak65


 domain sponsorship for one year



Heiko


 Heiko prepares some sample KML data and creates a Swisstopo map from that

title: consommation_energie_lausanne
text:
Consommation énergétique ville de Lausanne





Récupération de données de la ville de Lausanne et mise en forme pour une publication sur Open Street Map.


Data


Un fichier XLS contenant 6 onglets


 Description des données pour la ville de Lausanne

 Données de la ville de Lausanne

 Données OFS (rues) permettant de compléter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La clé permettant le croisement est STRID

 Données OFS (entrées) permettant de compléter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La clé permettant le croisement est EGID

 Données OFS (bâtiments) permettant de compléter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La clé permettant le croisement est EGID

 Données OFS (logement) permettant de compléter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La clé permettant le croisement est EGID



L'en tête des colonnes représentatives est en surbrillance (jaune)


Le document Merkmalskatalog_F.pdf      contient la description détaillée des colonnes pour les données OFS.


Team


 Jean-Daniel Bonjour

 Jean-Philippe Steck

 François Bianco

 Matthieu Reussner



Description


Représenter les consommations électrique des groupements de bâtiment sur la ville de Lausanne.


Pour minimiser l'impact sur la vie privée, nous moyennerons les consommations sur une certaine surface au lieu de représenter la consommation par adresse/bâtiment.


Links


 (www.google.com/publicdata/home ) Google public data explorer

 Opendata.org (exemple d'application similaire)



Résultats

Consommation nergtique ville de Lausanne

Rcupration de donnes de la ville de Lausanne et mise en forme pour une publication sur Open Street Map.

Data

Un fichier XLS contenant 6 onglets

  1. Description des donnes pour la ville de Lausanne
  2. Donnes de la ville de Lausanne
  3. Donnes OFS (rues) permettant de complter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La cl permettant le croisement est STRID
  4. Donnes OFS (entres) permettant de complter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La cl permettant le croisement est EGID
  5. Donnes OFS (btiments) permettant de complter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La cl permettant le croisement est EGID
  6. Donnes OFS (logement) permettant de complter le DATASET de la ville de Lausanne. La cl permettant le croisement est EGID

L'en tte des colonnes reprsentatives est en surbrillance (jaune)

Le document Merkmalskatalog_F.pdf contient la description dtaille des colonnes pour les donnes OFS.

Team

  • Jean-Daniel Bonjour
  • Jean-Philippe Steck
  • Franois Bianco
  • Matthieu Reussner

Description

Reprsenter les consommations lectrique des groupements de btiment sur la ville de Lausanne.

Pour minimiser l'impact sur la vie prive, nous moyennerons les consommations sur une certaine surface au lieu de reprsenter la consommation par adresse/btiment.

title: criminalite_et_sentiment_d_insecurite
text:
Criminalité et sentiment d'insécurité


Le sentiment de sécurité, ou d'insécurité, est-il en corrélation avec les statistiques sur la criminalité ?


L'idée serait de mettre en comparaison les statistiques officielles avec d'autres aspects, tels que par exemple:


 enquètes/sondages sur le sentiment d'(in-)sécurité et son évolution

 proportion d'articles relatant des crimes sur les périodes observées

 autre paramètre potentiellement intéressant



Data nécessaire


 Statistiques de criminalité 

 Sondages

 Extraction de statistiques de la presse suisse en général

 Autres chiffres pour comparaisons



Team


 die_s_man 



Remarques


Par exemple, c'est interessant de voir à quel point le taux des infractions de procuration des données pour les raisons illégitimes (Art. 143) se croise dans les dernières années. Une tendance alarmante!





Source: STAT-TAB

title: swiss_associations_directory
text:
Swiss associations directory


Annuaire des associations romandes


Situation de départ
Base de données (~2000 entrées) sur Filemaker 9 des associations romandes (vaudoises essentiellement, dans l’action sociale pour la plupart)
D’autres bases existent, il n’existe aucune centralisation de ces bases, on ne connait pas leur fréquence de mise à jour, ni leur formats, ni leur qualité (utilité des données)


Intentions
Mettre les données à disposition de tous les internautes
Permettre l’actualisation des données en ligne par les internautes 
Permettre à d’autres entités d’ajouter le contenu de leur propre base de données (enrichissement des données initiales)
Homogéniser de la qualité des données au travers d’une interface standardisée


Produit
Base accessible en ligne (sans identification préalable) de type à priori Wiki (Wikipedia)
Sélection par catégorie de service/public (voir site : www.asso1901.com)
Accès à une cartographie des organismes domiciliés (type Googlemap)


Data


 File Maker DB owned by the Bénévolat-Vaud association with HQ in Lausanne/VD

 Others data sources hosted into differents swiss websites



Team


 Sandrine

 Raul

	 charity,
	 dev,
	 design

title: green_street
text:
Ma Rue, est-elle verte? - Lausanne


How green is my street?





Using new open data provided by the City of Lausanne at Make Open Data 2011, we determine how “green” a street is by averaging the total energy usage of the buildings on it. This may be compared to the national average as detailed below.


To use the app, start typing the name of your street (i.e. Avenue, Rue, Chemin …), then click in the menu that appears to confirm. Data is loaded showing year-by-year energy consumption, as well as a map centered on the chosen street. Click on past years to see a visual representation of the building data available.


Developed as a CouchApp in JavaScript and HTML5, with a database conversion script written in Python. Embedded map of Lausanne from GeoAdmin. Check out consommation_energie_lausanne for a project which uses the same source data set to plot right on a map (we'd love to pull our efforts together ;)


Demo: http://opendata.utou.ch/lausanne/



Team


 loleg - code/design

 vasko - design/research



Kind thanks to Jean-Philippe Steck and the City of Lausanne for making this project possible.


Data


 Annual energy consumption figures of 50'000 buildings provided by the City of Lausanne (to be published soon)

 Indice de dépense énergétique (IDE) : 650 MJ/m2.an (moyenne suisse), Laboratoire de systèmes Energetiques EPFL, 2008 - Energy Consumption in Switzerland Report

html:
Ma Rue, est-elle verte? - Lausanne

How green is my street?

Using new open data provided by the City of Lausanne at Make Open Data 2011, we determine how green a street is by averaging the total energy usage of the buildings on it. This may be compared to the national average as detailed below.

To use the app, start typing the name of your street (i.e. Avenue, Rue, Chemin ), then click in the menu that appears to confirm. Data is loaded showing year-by-year energy consumption, as well as a map centered on the chosen street. Click on past years to see a visual representation of the building data available.

Developed as a CouchApp in JavaScript and HTML5, with a database conversion script written in Python. Embedded map of Lausanne from GeoAdmin. Check out consommation_energie_lausanne for a project which uses the same source data set to plot right on a map (we'd love to pull our efforts together ;)

Demo: http://opendata.utou.ch/lausanne/

title: health_on_duty
text:
"on duty" doctors and pharmacy near location


Could be useful to see where are the “on duty” doctors and pharmacy with a simple cross-platform layout (web).
 not sure data is available at a canton or swiss level, though.


it would be great to find a great “tank” to fish more raw data :)


here's a nice page concerning Lausanne data:
http://www.lausanne.ch/view.asp?DocId=20285 

 here's how I see the thing:
 1. where am I? (use GPS system)
 2. query pharmacy or hospital or doctor in area
 3. display on Gmaps or in simple html interface (for older mobile):
 3a. relevant near locations
 3b. if out of open hours, “on duty” near locations 
 4. if possible, add info such as tel, etc.

http://ligoo.ch/displayResult.php?e=pharmacie+lausanne 

 my 5 cents ;)


Data


 no open data found at the moment but still diggin



Team


 cobalt_pb 



Links


 A commercial “free” iPhone app was launched > http://www.pharmacity.ch

title: ch_euro_geigermaps
text:
CH Euro Geigermaps


This is more of a “lessons learned” project. It has been done before the MakeOpenData 2011, but might still be interesting. Also, its a good reason to publish the corresponding scraper source code.


In the wake of Fukushima the Japanese government did not publish enough radiation data. Makers around @kotobuki and @freaklabs began uploading DIY geiger counter measurements to Pachube, an open sensor data platform. The website http://japan.failedrobot.com/ created by the same people uses this data to display a map with sensor readings. More and more citizens began measuring such data or scraping official Web sites. The crowd sourced radiation data is probably not as accurate as official measurements, but a lot more information is available today than before Geigermaps and there is a sense of control no matter if the government decides to publish or hide its data.


A bit later, @haiyan and @pachube called for contributions to an european version of Geigermaps. She implemented the Web site and others provided the data. Here are the lessons learned from contributing the data for Switzerland. Measurements were scraped form the HTML of a government Web site, converted to  µSv/h and uploaded to one Pachube feed per measuring station. The location of the station was also added to the feed. And each feed carries the tag sensor:type=radiation which allows Geigermaps to find the relevant feeds.





Advantage:


- distributed, common platform enables collaboration
 - loosely coupled integration based on open standards
 - as long as everybody sticks to conventions, tools don't matter
 - open, everybody can contribute by tagging feeds appropriately


Problems:


- take care to use the same units (we had false “alarms” because of this)
 - unclear legal situation, government data is published, but no license to re-publish/use the data
 - nobody feels responsible for overall data quality and service uptime, initially not a problem, but on the long run


Data


 https://www.naz.ch/en/aktuell/tagesmittelwerte.shtml#tabelle 
 (Source, scraped with C# job running on a Laptop twice a day)

 https://pachube.com/feeds?q=tamberg+NEOC+NADAM&status=all 
 (Published to sensor value platform, feeds tagged with sensor:type=radiation and location)



Visualization


 http://japan.failedrobot.com/europe/ 
 (Implemented by @haiyan, Europe seems to be down, see Japan for example)



Team


 tamberg 



Source


 https://bitbucket.org/tamberg/makeopendata/src/ee8bd1770612/2011/CHEuroGeigerMaps/NeocNadamToPachube.cs 



Links


 http://pachube.com/ 



Back to project overview: http://makeopendata.ch/doku.php?do=search&id=@project


 concept,
	 eco,
	 hardware

CH Euro Geigermaps

This is more of a lessons learned project. It has been done before the MakeOpenData 2011, but might still be interesting. Also, its a good reason to publish the corresponding scraper source code.

In the wake of Fukushima the Japanese government did not publish enough radiation data. Makers around @kotobuki and @freaklabs began uploading DIY geiger counter measurements to Pachube, an open sensor data platform. The website http://japan.failedrobot.com/ created by the same people uses this data to display a map with sensor readings. More and more citizens began measuring such data or scraping official Web sites. The crowd sourced radiation data is probably not as accurate as official measurements, but a lot more information is available today than before Geigermaps and there is a sense of control no matter if the government decides to publish or hide its data.

A bit later, @haiyan and @pachube called for contributions to an european version of Geigermaps. She implemented the Web site and others provided the data. Here are the lessons learned from contributing the data for Switzerland. Measurements were scraped form the HTML of a government Web site, converted to Sv/h and uploaded to one Pachube feed per measuring station. The location of the station was also added to the feed. And each feed carries the tag sensor:type=radiation which allows Geigermaps to find the relevant feeds.

Advantage:

- loosely coupled integration based on open standards
- as long as everybody sticks to conventions, tools don't matter
- open, everybody can contribute by tagging feeds appropriately


Problems:

- unclear legal situation, government data is published, but no license to re-publish/use the data
- nobody feels responsible for overall data quality and service uptime, initially not a problem, but on the long run

    (Source, scraped with C# job running on a Laptop twice a day)
  • https://pachube.com/feeds?q=tamberg+NEOC+NADAM&status=all
